SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AccountController
Controller class for managing interactions in the account view.
DatabaseConnection
The DatabaseConnection class provides a singleton connection to a MySQL database.
DrumKit
The DrumKit class represents a collection of pads, each of which can be assigned a Sample.
DrumKitDAO
The DrumKitDAO class is responsible for performing CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) on DrumKit objects in a database.
Effect
The Effect class represents an audio effect that can be applied to a Sample.
FakeUserDAO
The FakeUserDAO class is a mock implementation of the UserDAO class that uses an in-memory data structure (a HashMap) to simulate database operations.
fileUploadController
Controller class for managing the pop-up that allows users to upload new music to use in the app.
HashUtil
The HashUtil class provides utility methods for hashing passwords using the SHA-256 algorithm.
IController
Interface containing functions that are common for all controller classes so that implementation is consistent
ISampleSaladDAO<T>
Data Access Object (DAO) interface for performing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations.
LibraryController
Controller class for managing interactions in the library view.
LoginController
Controller class for managing interactions in the login view.
MainController
Controller class for handling user interactions and scene transitions.
Metronome
The Metronome class represents a simple metronome with basic start/stop functionality and BPM (beats per minute) control.
MockDatabaseConnection
The MockDatabaseConnection class provides a singleton pattern implementation for establishing a connection to a SQLite database.
MockUserDAO
The MockUserDAO class provides an implementation of the ISampleSaladDAO interface for managing User objects using a mock database connection.
Pad
A triggerable object that holds and plays a sample, with properties for sensitivity, volume, and key binding, simulating the physical pads on an Akai MPC.
PadDAO
The PadDAO class handles CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) for Pad objects in a database.
PadEvent
A record of a pad activity.
PadEventDAO
The PadEventDAO class handles CRUD operations for PadEvent objects, storing and retrieving pad events from a SQL database.
PageLoader
 
Pattern
Stores a collection of pad events, representing a musical pattern that can be looped or played in sequence, with each event occurring at specific timestamps.
PatternDAO
The PatternDAO class provides data access methods for interacting with musical patterns in the database.
Project
Represents a music project containing multiple sequences (or a single sequence), with global settings such as BPM and project metadata.
ProjectDAO
Data Access Object (DAO) for interacting with the Project table in the database.
ProjectLoader
The ProjectLoader class is responsible for loading a music project from the database, including all its associated sequencers, patterns, and pad events.
ProjectSequenceDAO
The ProjectSequenceDAO class provides data access methods for managing the relationships between projects and sequencers in the database.
Sample
The Sample class represents an audio sample with various properties such as pitch, volume, start and end times.
SampleDAO
Data Access Object (DAO) for interacting with the Sample table in the database.
SampleSaladApplication
Main application class for launching the JavaFX application.
Sequencer
Manages the arrangement and playback of patterns, enabling the user to record, play, and edit sequences of pad events over time.
SequencerDAO
The SequencerDAO class is responsible for performing CRUD operations on Sequencer objects in the database.
SettingsController
Controller class for managing actions inside Settings view This class implements IController to inherit common functionalities and provides specific implementations for handling events in the library view.
SignupController
 
User
The User class represents a user in the system.
UserDAO
The UserDAO class provides data access methods for interacting with user records in a database.
UserService
The UserService class provides high-level services for managing users.
UserValidator
The UserValidator class provides utility methods for validating user inputs, such as email addresses, phone numbers, and passwords.
